skill.name: art-style-creator
skill.description: Create and define visual art styles for projects. Use when user wants to establish an art direction, create a style guide, define visual language, document aesthetic choices, or create consistent artwork guidelines for games, illustrations, animations, or other visual media.
skill.summary: Create and define visual art styles for projects. Use when user wants to establish an art direction,...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing art style guidance and reference materials. No executable code, network calls, or file system access detected. All content is educational material about visual design principles.

content.user_title: Create comprehensive art style guides for visual projects
content.value_statement: Establishing a consistent visual style is crucial for project cohesion, but many creators struggle to define their aesthetic direction. This skill provides a structured 10-step process to create detailed art style guides with color palettes, line work, shapes, composition, lighting, and technical specifications.
actual_capabilities: Guides through 10-step art style creation process
Generates comprehensive style documentation with templates
Provides color theory, composition, and lighting guidance
Includes technical specifications for different media
Offers genre-specific style presets and examples
Creates reusable style guides for teams
limitations: Does not generate actual artwork or images
Requires user input for project-specific decisions
Style guides need manual implementation by artists

use_cases.title: Define unique visual identity for games
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive art style guides that ensure consistent visuals across characters, environments, and UI elements for your game project.

use_cases.title: Develop personal artistic style
use_cases.description: Systematically explore and document your visual preferences to create a distinctive, cohesive art style for your portfolio or client work.

use_cases.title: Establish team style guidelines
use_cases.description: Build detailed style bibles that multiple artists can follow, ensuring visual consistency across large projects or series.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Style Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an art style for my fantasy illustration project. I want something whimsical but not childish, with a painterly feel.

prompt_templates.title: Game Art Direction
prompt_templates.scenario: Developing visual style for indie game
prompt_templates.prompt: I need an art style guide for a cozy farming simulation game. Target audience is casual players who enjoy Stardew Valley.

prompt_templates.title: Brand Visual Identity
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive art style for my eco-friendly brand that needs illustrations for web, print, and social media.

prompt_templates.title: Animation Style Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop a detailed animation art style for a sci-fi comedy series. It should be expressive but production-friendly for a small team.

output_examples.input: Create an art style for a dark fantasy game with gothic influences
output: Color Palette: Deep purples (#2D1B69) and burgundies (#800020) as dominant colors, with bone white (#F5F1E6) accents and gold (#FFD700) highlights
Line Work: Thick, variable weight outlines (3-5px) with a sketchy quality for organic feel
Shapes: Triangular/diamond shapes for architecture, elongated forms for characters, sharp silhouettes
Lighting: Low-key dramatic lighting with strong chiaroscuro, candle-light warmth, deep shadows
Texture: High detail with emphasis on stone, weathered materials, fabric textures, subtle grain overlay

best_practices: Reference existing styles as starting points but modify to create uniqueness
Document specific measurements and technical details for consistency
Create do's and don'ts sections with visual examples for clarity
Test style guide with multiple artists to ensure interpretability
anti_patterns: Copying popular styles exactly without adaptation or unique elements
Creating overly complex style guides that are difficult to follow
Ignoring technical constraints of your target platform or medium
Skipping the mood and emotional tone definition phase

faq.question: Can this skill generate actual artwork or images?
faq.answer: No, this skill creates written style guides and documentation. It helps define the visual direction but doesn't produce artwork itself.

faq.question: Is this suitable for 3D projects or only 2D art?
faq.answer: The principles apply to both, but the templates are optimized for 2D visual styles. 3D projects may need additional technical specifications.

faq.question: How detailed should my initial project description be?
faq.answer: Start with basic project type, target audience, and 3-5 descriptive words. The skill will guide you through discovering specific details.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing projects that need style consistency?
faq.answer: Yes, analyze your existing work to identify patterns, then document them using the templates to create a formal style guide.

faq.question: What if I'm not sure about my visual preferences?
faq.answer: The skill includes genre presets and reference materials. Start with these as foundations and modify based on what resonates with you.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring an art director?
faq.answer: This skill helps create the documentation an art director would produce, but you'll still need artistic skill to implement the style.
